Description: Entity which causes a level-change when entered, without showing up a scoreboard. Scores are no transferred. Can be set to only react to triggering. You can add master keyvalue manually to this entity.

keyChoices.choiceDescription: Cause trigger_changelevel to work like point entity, which means it need to be triggered to perform map change.
Do not override CVARs of destination map.

KeyDescriptions.keyDescription: Set name of {{ entname }} so other entities can trigger it to change level. Every trigger use-type works uniformly. Can be kill-targeted.
Name of the map to switch to.

Landmark used to work as an orientation point between two maps in a center of both trigger_changelevels of maps. It doesn't work in Sven Co-op, cause players starts at spawn points normally when new map loads.
If set to "Yes", player's ammo, armor and weapons are carried to target map.
Unknown purpose. Maybe it triggers a target in goal map.
Delays "Change Target" action, whatever that action does.
Percentage of total amount of players needed to reach this point in order for level change.

Notes: Trigger_changelevel supports to have a master (even if it is not listed in object properties). You can set it by adding "targetname" key with SmartEdit mode disabled.
Using the map cfg CVar nomaptrans followed by a map name will disable any trigger_changelevel entities with a matching map value, becoming solid walls that will block players.
Issues: Percentage of players needed feature only counts players currently touching the trigger_changelevel, i.e. players that have touched and no longer touching will not be counted.
